info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Schenectady, southeastern Hamilton, Fulton, northwestern Saratoga and central Montgomery Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Sacandaga Campground to near Caroga Lake Public Campground to near Ephratah. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Johnstown, Fonda and Sacandaga Campground around 600 PM EDT. Gloversville, Mayfield and Cranberry Creek around 605 PM EDT. Broadalbin, Fort Johnson, Tribes Hill and Northampton Beach Public Campground around 610 PM EDT. Northville around 615 PM EDT. Amsterdam, Hagaman and Edinburg around 620 PM EDT. Glenville, Galway, Day Center, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction and Rotterdam Junction around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Parkis Mills, Meco, West Perth, Sweets Crossing, Fultonville, Hoffmans, Glenwild, Young Corners, Whitehouse and Wiley Corners. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 27 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
